intro: Tridax leptophylla, commonly known as the slenderleaf tridax, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in a head. It is commonly found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Tridax leptophylla is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
